g2001.definition: [ἐπισχύω] from {{g1909}} and {{g2480}}; to avail further, i.e. (figuratively) insist stoutly

g2002.definition: [ἐπισωρεύω] from {{g1909}} and {{g4987}}; to accumulate further, i.e. (figuratively) seek additionally

g2003.definition: [ἐπιταγή] from {{g2004}}; an injunction or decree; by implication, authoritativeness

g2004.definition: [ἐπιτάσσω] from {{g1909}} and {{g5021}}; to arrange upon, i.e. order

g2005.definition: [ἐπιτελέω] from {{g1909}} and {{g5055}}; to fulfill further (or completely), i.e. execute; by implication, to terminate, undergo

g2006.definition: [ἐπιτήδειος] from ἐπιτηδές (enough); serviceable, i.e. (by implication) requisite

g2007.definition: [ἐπιτίθημι] from {{g1909}} and {{g5087}}; to impose (in a friendly or hostile sense)

g2008.definition: [ἐπιτιμάω] from {{g1909}} and {{g5091}}; to tax upon, i.e. censure or admonish; by implication, forbid

g2009.definition: [ἐπιτιμία] from a compound of {{g1909}} and {{g5092}}; properly, esteem, i.e. citizenship; used (in the sense of {{g2008}}) of a penalty

g2010.definition: [ἐπιτρέπω] from {{g1909}} and the base of {{g5157}}; to turn over (transfer), i.e. allow

g2011.definition: [ἐπιτροπή] from {{g2010}}; permission, i.e. (by implication) full power

g2012.definition: [ἐπίτροπος] from {{g1909}} and {{g5158}} (in the sense of {{g2011}}); a commissioner, i.e. domestic manager, guardian

g2013.definition: [ἐπιτυγχάνω] from {{g1909}} and {{g5177}}; to chance upon, i.e. (by implication) to attain

g2014.definition: [ἐπιφαίνω] from {{g1909}} and {{g5316}}; to shine upon, i.e. become (literally) visible or (figuratively) known

g2015.definition: [ἐπιφάνεια] from {{g2016}}; a manifestation, i.e. (specially) the advent of Christ (past or future)

g2018.definition: [ἐπιφέρω] from {{g1909}} and {{g5342}}; to bear upon (or further), i.e. adduce (personally or judicially (accuse, inflict)), superinduce

g2019.definition: [ἐπιφωνέω] from {{g1909}} and {{g5455}}; to call at something, i.e. exclaim

g2020.definition: [ἐπιφώσκω] a form of {{g2017}}; to begin to grow light

g2021.definition: [ἐπιχειρέω] from {{g1909}} and {{g5495}}; to put the hand upon, i.e. undertake

g2023.definition: [ἐπιχορηγέω] from {{g1909}} and {{g5524}}; to furnish besides, i.e. fully supply, (figuratively) aid or contribute

g2026.definition: [ἐποικοδομέω] from {{g1909}} and {{g3618}}; to build upon, i.e. (figuratively) to rear up

g2027.definition: [ἐποκέλλω] from {{g1909}} and ὀκέλλω (to urge); to drive upon the shore, i.e. to beach a vessel

g2028.definition: [ἐπονομάζω] from {{g1909}} and {{g3687}}; to name further, i.e. denominate

g2029.definition: [ἐποπτεύω] from {{g1909}} and a derivative of {{g3700}}; to inspect, i.e. watch

g2030.definition: [ἐπόπτης] from {{g1909}} and a presumed derivative of {{g3700}}; a looker-on

g2035.definition: [ἑπτακισχίλιοι] from {{g2034}} and {{g5507}}; seven times a thousand

g2036.definition: [ἔπω] a primary verb (used only in the definite past tense, the others being borrowed from {{g2046}}, {{g4483}}, and {{g5346}}); to speak or say (by word or writing) Compare {{g3004}}.

g2037.definition: [Ἔραστος] from ἐράω (to love); beloved; Erastus, a Christian

g2038.definition: [ἐργάζομαι] middle voice from {{g2041}}; to toil (as a task, occupation, etc.), (by implication) effect, be engaged in or with, etc.

g2039.definition: [ἐργασία] from {{g2040}}; occupation; by implication, profit, pains

g2040.definition: [ἐργάτης] from {{g2041}}; a toiler; figuratively, a teacher

g2041.definition: [ἔργον] from a primary (but obsolete) ἔργω (to work); toil (as an effort or occupation); by implication, an act

g2042.definition: [ἐρεθίζω] from a presumed prolonged form of {{g2054}}; to stimulate (especially to anger)

g2043.definition: [ἐρείδω] of obscure affinity; to prop, i.e. (reflexively) get fast

g2044.definition: [ἐρεύγομαι] of uncertain affinity; to belch, i.e. (figuratively) to speak out

g2045.definition: [ἐρευνάω] apparently from {{g2046}} (through the idea of inquiry); to seek, i.e. (figuratively) to investigate

g2046.definition: [ἐρέω] probably a fuller form of {{g4483}}; an alternate for {{g2036}} in certain tenses; to utter, i.e. speak or say

g2048.definition: [ἔρημος] of uncertain affinity; lonesome, i.e. (by implication) waste (usually as a noun, {{g5561}} being implied)

g2049.definition: [ἐρημόω] from {{g2048}}; to lay waste (literally or figuratively)

g2052.definition: [ἐριθεία] perhaps as the same as {{g2042}}; properly, intrigue, i.e. (by implication) faction

g2054.definition: [ἔρις] of uncertain affinity; a quarrel, i.e. (by implication) wrangling

g2055.definition: [ἐρίφιον] from {{g2056}}; a kidling, i.e. (genitive case) goat (symbolically, wicked person)

g2056.definition: [ἔριφος] perhaps from the same as {{g2053}} (through the idea of hairiness); a kid or (genitive case) goat

g2059.definition: [ἑρμηνεύω] from a presumed derivative of {{g2060}} (as the god of language); to translate

g2060.definition: [Ἑρμῆς] perhaps from {{g2046}}; Hermes, the name of the messenger of the Greek deities; also of a Christian

g2061.definition: [Ἑρμογένης] from {{g2060}} and {{g1096}}; born of Hermes; Hermogenes, an apostate Christian

g2062.definition: [ἑρπετόν] neuter of a derivative of ἕρπω (to creep); a reptile, i.e. (by Hebraism (compare {{h7431}})) a small animal

g2063.definition: [ἐρυθρός] of uncertain affinity; red, i.e. (with {{g2281}}) the Red Sea

g2064.definition: [ἔρχομαι] middle voice of a primary verb  (used only in the present and imperfect tenses, the others being  supplied by a kindred (middle voice)             ἐλεύθομαι,    or (active)      ἔλθω,        which do not otherwise occur); to come or go (in a great variety of applications, literally and  figuratively)

g2065.definition: [ἐρωτάω] apparently from {{g2046}} (compare {{g2045}}); to interrogate; by implication, to request Compare {{g4441}}.

g2068.definition: [ἐσθίω] strengthened for a primary ἔδω (to eat); used only in certain tenses, the rest being supplied by {{g5315}}; to eat (usually literal)

g2069.definition: [Ἐσλί] of Hebrew origin (probably for {{h454}}); Esli, an Israelite

g2070.definition: [ἐσμέν] first person plural indicative of {{g1510}}; we are

g2072.definition: [ἔσοπτρον] from {{g1519}} and a presumed derivative of {{g3700}}; a mirror (for looking into) Compare {{g2734}}.

g2073.definition: [ἑσπέρα] feminine of an adjective hesperos (evening); the eve ({{g5610}} being implied)

g2074.definition: [Ἐσρώμ] of Hebrew origin ({{h2696}}); Esrom (i.e. Chetsron), an Israelite

g2075.definition: [ἐστέ] second person plural present indicative of {{g1510}}; ye are

g2076.definition: [ἐστί] third person singular present indicative of {{g1510}}; he (she or it) is; also (with neuter plural) they are

g2077.definition: [ἔστω] second person singular present imperative of {{g1510}}; be thou;  also  ἔστωσαν, third person of the same; let them be

g2078.definition: [ἔσχατος] a superlative probably from {{g2192}} (in the sense of contiguity); farthest, final (of place or time)

g2079.definition: [ἐσχάτως] adverb from {{g2078}}; finally, i.e. (with {{g2192}}) at the extremity of life

g2081.definition: [ἔσωθεν] from {{g2080}}; from inside; also used as equivalent to {{g2080}} (inside)

g2084.definition: [ἑτερόγλωσσος] from {{g2087}} and {{g1100}}; other- tongued, i.e. a foreigner

g2086.definition: [ἑτεροζυγέω] from a compound of {{g2087}} and {{g2218}}; to yoke up differently, i.e. (figuratively) to associate discordantly

g2087.definition: [ἕτερος] of uncertain affinity; (an-, the) other or different

g2089.definition: [ἔτι] perhaps akin to {{g2094}}; "yet," still (of time or degree)

g2092.definition: [ἕτοιμος] from an old noun ἐτεός (fitness); adjusted, i.e. ready

g2094.definition: [ἔτος] apparently a primary word; a year

g2095.definition: [εὖ] neuter of a primary εὖς (good); (adverbially) well

g2096.definition: [Εὖα] of Hebrew origin ({{h2332}}); Eua (or Eva, i.e. Chavvah), the first woman

g2097.definition: [εὐαγγελίζω] from {{g2095}} and {{g32}}; to announce good news ("evangelize") especially the gospel

g2098.definition: [εὐαγγέλιον] from the same as {{g2097}}; a good message, i.e. the gospel

g2099.definition: [εὐαγγελιστής] from {{g2097}}; a preacher of the gospel
